sen.j: 孝安天皇（こうあんてんのう、孝昭天皇49年（紀元前427年）- 孝安天皇102年1月9日 (旧暦)（紀元前291年2月27日））は、『古事記』『日本書紀』に伝えられる第6代の天皇（在位：孝安天皇元年1月7日 (旧暦)（紀元前392年3月3日） - 同102年1月9日 (旧暦)（紀元前291年2月27日））。
sen.e: Emperor Koan (A.D.427-February 23, A.D.291) was the sixth Emperor, who is described in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) (Reign: February 26, A.D.392-February 23, A.D.291).

Emperor Koan (427 B.C. - February 23, 291 B.C.) was the sixth emperor (reign: February 26, 392 B.C. - February 23, 291 B.C.), being described in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: A.D. を B.C.に変更グレゴリオ暦に変更
sen.e: Emperor Koan (427 B.C. - February 23, 291 B.C.) was the sixth emperor (reign: February 26, 392 B.C. - February 23, 291 B.C.), being described in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 日本足彦国押人尊（やまとたらしひこくにおしひとのみこと）・大倭帯日子国押人命（古事記）。
sen.e: In "Kojiki", he is called Yamatotarashihiko kunioshihitonomikoto or Oyamatotarashihiko Kunioshihitonomikoto.
In Kojiki, he is called Yamatotarashihiko kunioshihitonomikoto or Oyamatotarashihiko Kunioshihitonomikoto.
sen.cmt: Kojiki から引用符を削除
sen.e: In Kojiki, he is called Yamatotarashihiko kunioshihitonomikoto or Oyamatotarashihiko Kunioshihitonomikoto.

sen.j: いわゆる欠史八代の一人で、実在しない天皇と捉える見方が一般的である（実在説もある）。
sen.e: He was one of the so called Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns), and it is commonly understood that he was the nonexistent Emperor (There is also the theory of his real existence).
He was one of the so called Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns), and it is commonly understood that he was a nonexistent Emperor (there is also the theory of his existence).
sen.cmt: the nonexistent Emperorを a nonexistent Emperorに変更。his real existenceのreal を削除。
sen.e: He was one of the so called Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns), and it is commonly understood that he was a nonexistent Emperor (there is also the theory of his existence).
Imperial Palace
Imperial Palace
Imperial Palace

sen.j: 都は室秋津島宮（むろのあきづしまのみや。
sen.e: The capital was Muro no akizushima no miya.
The capital was Muro no akizushima no miya.
The capital was Muro no akizushima no miya.

sen.j: 現在の奈良県御所市室）。
sen.e: (Present Muro, Gose City, Nara Prefecture)
(It is present Muro, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.)
(It is present Muro, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.)
Achievements
Achievements
Achievements

sen.j: 事績は全く伝えられていない。
sen.e: There is no description about his achievements.
There is no description about his achievements.
There is no description about his achievements.

sen.j: 孝昭天皇68年正月（紀元前408年）に立太子し、同83年（紀元前393年）父天皇の崩御に伴い、翌年正月に即位した。
sen.e: In February, A.D.408, he was formally installed as Crown Prince, and after the death of his father in A.D. 393, he ascended the throne on next New Year's Day.
In February, 408 B.C., he was formally installed as Crown Prince, and after the death of his father in 393 B.C., he ascended the throne on next New Year's Day.
sen.cmt: A.D. を B.C. に変更
sen.e: In February, 408 B.C., he was formally installed as Crown Prince, and after the death of his father in 393 B.C., he ascended the throne on next New Year's Day.

sen.j: 在位102年は歴代天皇中最長だが、信憑性は皆無である。
sen.e: The period of his reign was 102 years and he was the longest serving Emperor in the former Emperors, however it is unreliable.
The period of his reign as Emperor was 102 years, which is the longest among the successive Emperors so far, however it is very much unreliable.
The period of his reign as Emperor was 102 years, which is the longest among the successive Emperors so far, however it is very much unreliable.
According to "Kojiki", he died at the age of 123, while according to "Nihonshoki", he died at the age of 137.
According to Kojiki, he died at the age of 123, while according to Nihonshoki, he died at the age of 137.
sen.cmt: Kojiki およびNihonshokiから引用符を削除
sen.e: According to Kojiki, he died at the age of 123, while according to Nihonshoki, he died at the age of 137.
Imperial mausoleum・
Imperial mausoleum
Imperial mausoleum

sen.j: 玉手丘上陵（たまでのおかのえのみささぎ）に葬られたという。
sen.e: It is said that he was buried in Tamade no okanoeno misasagi.
It is said that he was buried in Tamade no okanoeno misasagi.
It is said that he was buried in Tamade no okanoeno misasagi.

sen.j: 現在、同陵は奈良県御所市大字玉手の玉手丘陵上に所在する円墳に比定されている。
sen.e: Currently, this misasagi is identified with the round barrow, which was located in Tamade no okanoeno misasagi,Tamade, Oaza, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 正しくは、玉手丘上陵だと思われます。
sen.e: Currently, this misasagi is identified with the round barrow, which was located in Tamade no okanoeno misasagi, Tamade, Oaza, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Tamadeの前にスペースを挿入
sen.e: Currently, this misasagi is identified with the round barrow, which was located in Tamade no okanoeno misasagi, Tamade, Oaza, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.
